column4: Hi, I have put '0 */6 * * * rsync -aq --delete rsync/rsync.torproject.org/tor/ /srv/www/mirror.gb.com/tor' in a crontab to start running a mirror for a website. Although after 24 hours nothing is located in that folder. What should I check first?

Hi, I have put '0 */6 * * * rsync -aq --delete rsync/rsync.torproject.org/tor/ /srv/www/mirror.gb.com/tor' in a crontab to start running a mirror for a website. Although after 24 hours nothing is located in that folder. What should I check first?
what do you mean? I don't have e-mail on this server
huh? I have a rsync problem not mail problem
no you have most probably a cron problem. and guess what cron does when it encounters a problem: it MAILS!
so where would it mail? do i just type '$ mail?
for example. yes. dunno how and if you have set up local mail
do a dummy cronjob to check if the job runs as intended. then put your command inside a script which also does something you know that it ran
if your mail system had worked, cron would have sent you the error message, alerting you to the problem
how should I just install a basic mail system, where processes can e-mail me locally?
just install a SMTP server yes. should be configured like this out of the box. don't let port 25 from outside reach you. if you are behind a NAT no config necessary
